poem:
Title: "Effigies of Economy"

Glass towers cross-hatch dawn with steel and digits,
where Deloitte dreams in ledgers, inverts tax.
The market's heart syncs to the tick of oil-rigged clocks.
Spring stirs bricked dreams to life - a floral litmus.
Yet every bloom is wrought with economic dread,
a slow dance of cost and cut, of thrive, of shred.
